bugs.title: CVE-2017-8782 ming: Integer overflow in the readString function [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-8782 ming: Integer overflow in the readString function [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-8782 ming: Integer overflow in the readString function

long_desc.thetext:
The readString function in util/read.c and util/old/read.c in libming 0.4.8 allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a large file that is mishandled by listswf, listaction, etc. This occurs because of an integer overflow that leads to a memory allocation error.

References:

http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/May/106

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1457345]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1457344

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
Will be fixed in 0.4.9, which upstream is about to release.

This message is a reminder that Fedora 25 is nearing its end of life.
Approximately 4 (four) weeks from now Fedora will stop maintaining
and issuing updates for Fedora 25. It is Fedora's policy to close all
bug reports from releases that are no longer maintained. At that time
this bug will be closed as EOL if it remains open with a Fedora  'version'
of '25'.

Package Maintainer: If you wish for this bug to remain open because you
plan to fix it in a currently maintained version, simply change the 'version'
to a later Fedora version.

Thank you for reporting this issue and we are sorry that we were not
able to fix it before Fedora 25 is end of life. If you would still like
to see this bug fixed and are able to reproduce it against a later version
of Fedora, you are encouraged  change the 'version' to a later Fedora
version prior this bug is closed as described in the policy above.

Although we aim to fix as many bugs as possible during every release's
lifetime, sometimes those efforts are overtaken by events. Often a
more recent Fedora release includes newer upstream software that fixes
bugs or makes them obsolete.
No new release from upstream with a fix for this yet. Bumping to rawhide.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 28 development cycle.
Changing version to '28'.

CVE-2017-9988

The readEncUInt30 function in util/read.c in libming 0.4.8 mishandles memory allocation. A crafted input will lead to a remote denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) attack against parser.c.

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/85

CVE-2017-9989

util/outputtxt.c in libming 0.4.8 mishandles memory allocation. A crafted input will lead to a remote denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) attack.

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/86

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11728 ming: heap-based buffer over-read in OpCode via decompileSETMEMBER

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer over-read was found in the function OpCode (called
from decompileSETMEMBER) in util/decompile.c in Ming 0.4.8, which
allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/82

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1476729]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11729 ming: heap-based buffer over-read in OpCode via decompileINCR_DECR

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer over-read was found in the function OpCode (called
from decompileINCR_DECR line 1440) in util/decompile.c in Ming 0.4.8,
which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/79

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1476729]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11730 ming: heap-based buffer over-read in OpCode via decompileINCR_DECR

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer over-read was found in the function OpCode (called
from decompileINCR_DECR line 1474) in util/decompile.c in Ming 0.4.8,
which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/81

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1476729]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11731 ming: invalid memory read in OpCode via isLogicalOp and decompileIF

long_desc.thetext:
An invalid memory read vulnerability was found in the function OpCode
(called from isLogicalOp and decompileIF) in util/decompile.c in Ming
0.4.8, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a
crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/84

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1476729]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11732 ming: heap-based buffer overflow in dcputs via decompileIMPLEMENTS

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the function
dcputs (called from decompileIMPLEMENTS) in util/decompile.c in Ming
0.4.8, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a
crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/80

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1476729]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11733 ming: null pointer dereference in stackswap via decompileSTACKSWAP

long_desc.thetext:
A null pointer dereference vulnerability was found in the function
stackswap (called from decompileSTACKSWAP) in util/decompile.c in Ming
0.4.8, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a
crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/78

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1476729]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11734 ming: heap-based buffer over-read in decompileCALLFUNCTION

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer over-read was found in the function
decompileCALLFUNCTION in util/decompile.c in Ming 0.4.8, which allows
attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/83

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1476729]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-16898 ming: Buffer overflow in the printMP3Headers function

long_desc.thetext:
The printMP3Headers function in util/listmp3.c in libming v0.4.8 or earlier is vulnerable to a global buffer overflow, which may allow attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-9264.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/75

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2017-16883 CVE-2018-5251 CVE-2018-5294 CVE-2018-6315 ming: various flaws [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-16883 CVE-2018-5251 CVE-2018-5294 CVE-2018-6315 ming: various flaws [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-16883 ming: NULL pointer dereference in outputscript.c:outputSWF_TEXT_RECORD can lead to DoS

long_desc.thetext:
The outputSWF_TEXT_RECORD function in util/outputscript.c in libming <= 0.4.8 is vulnerable to a NULL pointer dereference, which may allow attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted swf file.

References:
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16883
https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/77
https://github.com/libming/libming/pull/94

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1520747]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-5294 ming: Integer overflow in the readUInt32function

long_desc.thetext:
In libming 0.4.8, there is an integer overflow (caused by an out-of-range left shift) in the readUInt32 function (util/read.c). Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted swf file.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/98

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1520747]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-5251 ming: Integer overflow in read.c:readSBits() can cause a denial of service via a crafted .swf file

long_desc.thetext:
In libming 0.4.8, there is an integer signedness error vulnerability (left shift of a negative value) in the readSBits function (util/read.c). Remote attackers can leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted swf file.

References:
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-5251
https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/97

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1520747]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-6315 ming: Integer overflow in util/outputscript.c:outputSWF_TEXT_RECORD results in out-of-bounds read

long_desc.thetext:
The outputSWF_TEXT_RECORD function (util/outputscript.c) in libming through 0.4.8 is vulnerable to an integer overflow and resultant out-of-bounds read, which may allow attackers to cause a denial of service or unspecified other impact via a crafted SWF file.

External References:
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-6315
https://github.com/libming/libming/issues/101

Created ming tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1520747]

bugs.title: CVE-2018-6359 ming: User-after-free in decompileIF function in util/decompile.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-6359 ming: User-after-free in decompileIF function in util/decompile.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-6359 ming: User-after-free in decompileIF function in util/decompile.c

long_desc.thetext:
The decompileIF function (util/decompile.c) in libming through 0.4.8 is vulnerable to a use-after-free, which may allow attackers to cause a denial of service or unspecified other impact via a crafted SWF file.

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1539903,1539904

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: ming-0.4.8-7.fc28 FTBFS: configure: error: cannot import Python module "distutils".

bugzilla.short_desc: ming-0.4.8-7.fc28 FTBFS: configure: error: cannot import Python module "distutils".

long_desc.thetext:
ming-0.4.8-7.fc28 fails to build in F28:

checking for python... /usr/bin/python
checking for python... (cached) /usr/bin/python
checking for a version of Python >= '2.1.0'... DEPRECATION WARNING: python2 invoked with /usr/bin/python.
    Use /usr/bin/python3 or /usr/bin/python2
    /usr/bin/python will be removed or switched to Python 3 in the future.
    If you cannot make the switch now, please follow instructions at https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Avoid_usr_bin_python_in_RPM_Build#Quick_Opt-Out
yes
checking for the distutils Python package... no
configure: error: cannot import Python module "distutils".
Please check your Python installation. The error was:
DEPRECATION WARNING: python2 invoked with /usr/bin/python.
    Use /usr/bin/python3 or /usr/bin/python2
    /usr/bin/python will be removed or switched to Python 3 in the future.
    If you cannot make the switch now, please follow instructions at https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Avoid_usr_bin_python_in_RPM_Build#Quick_Opt-Out
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.qzcZjH (%build)

This happens since this build root change <https://apps.fedoraproject.org/koschei/build/4205008>. I think you should migrate to Python3.
